abstract: A federal judge ruled that Transocean, the owner of the Deepwater Horizon, which blew out in the Gulf of Mexico in 2010, was not liable for some pollution claims.
snippet: A federal judge ruled that Transocean, the owner of the Deepwater Horizon, which blew out in the Gulf of Mexico in 2010, was not liable for some pollution claims.
lead_paragraph: Transocean, the owner of the Deepwater Horizon rig, which blew out in the Gulf of Mexico nearly two years ago, is not liable for some of the pollution claims arising from the fatal accident, a federal judge in Louisiana ruled on Thursday.

headline.main: Ruling Favors Owner of Rig in Gulf Spill
headline.print_headline: Ruling Favors Owner of Rig In Gulf Spill
